definition: to drink a toast/Cheers! (proposing a toast)/Here's to you!/Bottoms up!/lit. dry cup
dry/clean/in vain/dried food/foster/adoptive/to ignore
variant of 乾|干[gan1]
old variant of 乾|干[gan1]
to concern/to interfere/shield/stem
surname Gan
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
variant of 杯[bei1]/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup
variant of 杯[bei1]
cup/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup

sentences.english: Everywhere I went I had to toast and drink with the people there, and after a few rounds I felt a little tipsy.
sentences.chinese: 每到一处均要跟人干杯，酒过三巡，我已经有些醉意。

sentences.english: Let us all now drink a toast to the future success of the company.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们大家一起来干杯，祝公司未来鸿图大展。

sentences.english: People at a stable will usually “Gan Bei” when toasting each other.
sentences.chinese: 人们往往以“干杯”的方式互相敬酒。

sentences.english: Drink toasts of love and commitment.
sentences.chinese: 为相爱和海誓山盟而干杯。

sentences.english: He proposed a toast to both the bride and bridegroom.
sentences.chinese: 他提议为新娘和新郎干杯。

sentences.english: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the President!
sentences.chinese: 女士们，先生们，我提议为总统干杯。

sentences.english: We drank a toast to the Alto.
I propose a toast to the friendship between the peoples of the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我提议为两国人民的友谊干杯。

sentences.english: May I have your attention, please?I’d like to propose a toast to Harry.
sentences.chinese: 请大家听我说，我提议大家为哈利干杯。

sentences.english: I wish to propose a toast to our friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我建议为我们的友谊干杯。

sentences.english: It's considered impolite to clink glasses unless you say "cheers".
sentences.chinese: 碰杯被认为是不礼貌的，除非当你说“干杯”时。

sentences.english: Let's drink to the success of your school.
sentences.chinese: 让我们为你校的成功干杯。

sentences.english: Prepare to raise your glass to some cheering news.
sentences.chinese: 准备好为一些令人欢呼的消息干杯吧。

sentences.english: "Maybe, what if we do a toast, " said Rick holding his wineglass high.
sentences.chinese: “也许吧，我们干杯怎么样？”瑞克高举酒杯。

definition: to toast sb (with wine etc)/to drink a toast
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
to drain the cup in one gulp (idiom)
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
to drink a toast
to raise one's wine cup
to drink one's fill
to have a few drinks/to drink to one's heart's content
to respect/to venerate/to salute/to offer
to drink up/to finish (a drink)
to toast/to propose a toast
short speech given in proposing a toast
a thousand cups of wine is not too much when best friends meet (idiom)/when you're with close friends, you can let your hair down
pinyin: jiu3 feng2 zhi1 ji3 qian1 bei1 shao3

definition: formal exchange of cups of wine between bride and groom as traditional wedding ceremony
to drink (alcohol)

Auld Lang Syne, Scottish song with lyrics by Robert Burns 羅伯特·伯恩斯|罗伯特·伯恩斯[Luo2 bo2 te4 · Bo2 en1 si1], sung to mark the start of a new year or as a farewell/also rendered 友誼萬歲|友谊万岁[You3 yi4 wan4 sui4] or 友誼天長地久|友谊天长地久[You3 yi4 tian1 chang2 di4 jiu3]
pinyin: You3 yi4 di4 jiu3 tian1 chang2
